msContents.summary: The Ñāṉanaṭcēttiramālai, that is, The garland of celestial knowledge, a Christian text in honour of the Holy Mary, attributed to Jean Venance Bouchet (1655-1732), a French Jesuit missionnary in South India (see Clooney 2005, p. 73-74).

collation.desc: 1 folios= front guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

222 folios = Ñāṉanaṭcēttiramālai: Mūlam. Tamil foliation [1]-222. Blank pages: f16v, f24v, f31v, f39v, f53v, f60v, f62v, f66v, f105v, f110v, f114v, f132v, f134v, f139v, f144v, f150v, f163v, f178v, f201v, f207v, f211v, f213v.

binding.p: Original wood covers. 340 x 35 x mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. From the aspect of the leaves and the script style, the manuscript seems to date, at the latest, to the beginning of the 19th century.

acquisition.p: Manuscript hold by M. Bernolle (Île-de-France). The manuscript was acquired by its actual owner from his father, who himself received it as a gift approximately in the 1960s, from a colleague, probably of Tamil origin.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
